intro: Jatropha jaenensis, commonly known as the Jaén jatropha, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly in regions of Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It produces small, toxic, orange-red berries that contain seeds. Jatropha jaenensis is often found in dry, disturbed habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
